children.author: speedywrx
Dominian
speedywrx
Dominian
juliancolton
children.comment: Yeah, I've done things like this before. It could theoretically be a composite, but not necessarily.
Didn't think of that. Could totally work like that.
It's also not a spotlight - just a speedlight (off camera flash) zoomed in. Yes, you can zoom speedlights so it doesn't spread light as much

children.author: speedywrx
speedywrx
speedywrx
children.comment: If you look carefully around the guys head you can see a bit a motion blur too until the flash pops to freeze their motion
I'm not saying they remained perfectly still either.  I'm just saying there is not enough light in the field to expose them without flash
True, but incorrect assumption. It is a long exposure, couple in dark field remains still. Then flash after X-seconds which freezes them.
Starry night needs long exposure. People would be blurry in a long exposure shot and their spotlight would be super bright.
What part of this do you think is Photoshop?

data.comment: Photoshop makes cool things happen
